full_text: Screened by NARA, 7/28/2023 19. If in the U.S. is your spouse included in your request for asylum? Yes No (If not, explain why) Yes, she is included in my application. 20. If in the U.S. is spouse making separate application for asylum? Yes No (If not, explain why) No, she is not making separate application, she is applying with me. 21. If in the U.S. are children included in your request for asylum? Yes No (If not, explain why) My four children are of legal age, besides that they already submitted their application for asylum. One of them is already granted and two of them are covered by the new immigration law. 22. I have 4 sons or daughters as follows: (Complete all columns as to each son or daughter. If living with you state "with me" in last column; otherwise give city and state or foreign country of son's or daughter's residence). Name Sex Place of birth Date of birth Now living at MARTA ORTEGA F Nicaragua 11/1/44 with me MARIA CHAVARRIA F Nicaragua 5/15/47 Miami, Florida FOIA (b)(6) 23. Relatives in U.S. other than immediate family Name Address Relationship Immigration status None 24. Other relatives who are refugees but outside the U.S. Name Relationship Country where presently located None 25. List all travel or identity documents such as national passport, refugee convention travel document or national identity card Issuing country or Date of Date of Document type Document number Cost authority issue expiration Obtained by whom My passport have been loose, but it was issued in Honduras, something that I requested due to my fear to go to the Nicaraguan Consulate and ask for a Nicaraguan passport. I am going to present my Birth Certificate. 26. Why did you obtain a U.S. visa? To travel to the United States. 27. If you did not apply for a U.S. visa, explain why not? N/A 28. Date of departure from your country of nationality 29. Was exit permission required to leave your country? Yes No (If so, did you obtain exit (Mo/Day/Yr) permission Yes No (If not, explain why) July 17, 1979 I came out from Nicaragua in the middle of the Civil War, on 7/17/79 walking. I did not get any permission. (2)
